answers.answer: Hey Kev,First off, I am not a doctor but I totally understand your frustration.  My grandmother was on so many meds before her death that it was ridiculous..... My mother had a hard time keeping everything straight, and although my grandma still had it all together mentally, they had her drugged up enough that she really didn't give a damn about anything.  (That sux!)What I'd suggest you do in regards to your issues is, talk with a primary care physician. (Perhaps not the one who couldn't remember if he took out your bro's gallbladder.)  Tell him/her about your stress and anger (both are valid and understandable) and perhaps they can put you in touch with a mental health professional that can help you weed things out.  (Maybe a psychiatrist or another type of therapist)I had a issues that I tried to handle for years on my own, and it was a mistake.  After growing a pair and going to talk with a therapist, I am a completely different man.  (I take one med for my head, get plenty of exercise, eat right, drink plenty of water, etc.)Hope this helps Kev.  Take care.

I appreciate your advise but i'm just venting. this is how i tell other people about my experiences and i'm sure a few doctors read it, even though they could probably care less it makes me feel better to be able to express how i feel about the medical society now days. So its kind of like my own little theropy.LOL
Absolutely, blowing out isn't a bad thing if it accomplishes what it's supposed too.
